attributes.action: Parents whose children commit criminal offences should face legal action by the courts, up to the full sentence that an adult would receive for the same offence.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Parents whose children commit criminal offences should face legal action by the courts, up to the full sentence that an adult would receive for the same offence.
The assumption should be that parents are responsible for their children (whilst under the legal adult age). The onus should be on parents to prove that they are not responsible (by action or inaction) for the behaviour of their children.
If parents cannot demonstrate that they have acted reasonably responsibly, then they should at the least face some form of compulsory parental training. If it can be shown that they are directly responsible, or may even have encouraged the criminal actions of their children, then they should receive the full sentence that an adult would receive, for the offence their child has committed.
